edu.ncsu.csc216.checkout_simulator.queues

Class Store

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.checkout_simulator.queues.Store
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LineOfItems

    public class Store
extends java.lang.Object
implements LineOfItems
    The Store class serves as a first-in-first-out type of queue that handles Cart objects that are currently still shopping in the store and have not been placed in a Register's checkout line.
    Author:
    Steven Mayo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Store(int numberOfCarts, CheckoutRegister[] register)
      Constructor for the Store object, which creates a first-in-first-out queue for Cart objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int departTimeNext()
      Returns the time, in seconds, that a Cart at the front of the shopping queue will leave and enter the CheckoutRegister queue.
      boolean hasNext()
      Returns true if the shopping cart queue is not empty, false otherwise.
      Cart processNext()
      Removes a Cart object from the shopping queue and sends it a getInLine message.
      int size()
      Returns the number of Carts still in the shopping queue.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Store

        public Store(int numberOfCarts,
             CheckoutRegister[] register)
        Constructor for the Store object, which creates a first-in-first-out queue for Cart objects. The number of Cart objects still shopping is determined/created by the CartFactory class and new Carts are added to the queue based on their arrivalTime.
        Parameters:
        numberOfCarts - The number of carts still currently shopping.
        register - An array containing the CheckoutRegister objects.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of Carts still in the shopping queue.
        Specified by:
        size in interface LineOfItems
        Returns:
        The number of carts remaining in the shopping cart queue.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns true if the shopping cart queue is not empty, false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface LineOfItems
        Returns:
        True if the shopping cart queue is not empty.

      • processNext

        public Cart processNext()
        Removes a Cart object from the shopping queue and sends it a getInLine message.
        Specified by:
        processNext in interface LineOfItems
        Returns:
        Cart The most recent cart removed from the shopping queue.

      • departTimeNext

        public int departTimeNext()
        Returns the time, in seconds, that a Cart at the front of the shopping queue will leave and enter the CheckoutRegister queue. If the shopping queue is empty, the maximum queue time specified for that particular Cart's type will be returned instead.
        Specified by:
        departTimeNext in interface LineOfItems
        Returns:
        The time that a Cart will exit the shopping queue and enter the checkout queue.
